channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Street cleansing needs to be done, 24th July
item.description:
The WHOLE street needs proper street cleansing weekly as it says it will online, broken glass, litter, food packaging, bottles, cans, footpath and where cars are parks needs proper cleaning
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 87, Southlands Road, Bickley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Ped green/red man lights swung round, 24th July
item.description:
On side of road near Centre Point the ped lights have swung round making it hard to see them Maybe the whole set of lights have been swung round (traffic lights too)
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 269, Tottenham Court Road, Bloomsbury, London

item.title: Street Lighting is not working, 24th July
item.description:
The lights post is not working. This street light post is exactly opposite Flat 1 Southall Place. This is a busy walking area at night, no light at this side of Southall Place, please can you ensure lights changed/ programmed, for everyone's safety. Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pilgrimage Street, The Borough, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly-posting on trees in and near Kyverdale Road, 24th July
item.description:
A number of trees in the area have been covered with posters in Hebrew. These seem to be advertisements of some sort, since a phone number and prices are given. But this is not the first time that posters in Hebrew have been fixed to trees in this area.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Lampard Grove, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 2nd request abondoned bin on corner full off overspill, 24th July
item.description:
This bin has been there for 3 weeks full of overspill and does not belong to this household its a green top one. Its been left in the middle of the pavement maki g it hazardous for anyone on a mobility scooter to go round. Hence there is a pharmacy at the end of Burrage place so mobility person's need access to tbe pavement

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 212, Burrage Road, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: 1-2 inch Concrete ridge that runs between Coop car park and pavement on Elmers End Road, it blends in visually and is very easy to trip over., 24th July
item.description:
There is a small concrete ridge running alongside Coop car park. It's easy to trip over. I sustained a head injury. Then, later when the ambulance arrived one of the ambulance crew tripped over it as well but didn't fall over.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Elmers End Road, Anerley, London
Report on FixMyStreet
